history.content:
The question in the title, you answered it..

For your actual question, I find any opportunity to connect with company recruiters in-person valuable. It is a chance to impress and hopefully, make an impact.

children.subject: Ya but they're charging money for it, nasty..
EWI includes a nice dinner tho, and sales are used to help fund other events.

Recruiting event info is kinda scattered all over the place...many are publicized through newsletters and Facebook pages. Also if you can't go to career fair kinda events you can go to more info sessions, bc most of the time when a company has an infosession they're also recruiting and those events have smaller turnouts so you have more one-on-one time with company representatives. By the way if you're free nov 14 you can attend Evening with Industry with SWE! It has a mini career fair and a dinner during which you can chat with company reps, and is a good environment to connect with recruiters.

history.content:
This fall season seems to be pretty much over, really wanna get it together for spring. How do you all find out about recruiting events? I know there's the EECS Department sponsored events as well as Career Center events on Handshake, and occasionally you'll find something on Facebook too (though I'm trying to use it less so maybe not an option for me). Of course, career fairs too. 

I wasn't able to go to a lot of these this semester. Which kinds of events do you find the most useful for getting an internship?
history.subject: How to find recruiting events?
